Welcome to Assignment1’s documentation!

LoadOntology Module

ROS node for creating the ontology

class scripts.load_ontology.CreateMap[source]

This class contains all the method used to create the topological map

LoadMap()[source]

Function initializing the environment in which the robot should move. This mechanism is generalized in a way in which every envirnoment can be created. The creation of the environment is done via call to armor server.

Parameters

None –

Returns

None

get_input(location)[source]

Function checking if the value taken as input is an integer

Parameters

location (int) – 0 if corrdiors are request, 1 if rooms rea request

Returns

An integern number

Return type

number(int)

not_int(value)[source]

Function checking if the value is an integer or not

Parameters

value – input value

Returns

if not an int

Return type

1

Returns

if an int

Return type

0

StateMachine Module

ROS node for implementing the Finite State Machine.

Service:

/server_name: introspection server for visualization

class scripts.state_machine.DecideTarget(interface_helper, behavior_helper)[source]

A class to implement the behavior of the decision state of the robot.

Class constructor, i.e., class initializer. Input parameters are:

  • interface_helper: the helper class invoked to interface with the server.

  • behavior_hleper: the helper class invoked to interface with the behavior.

execute(userdata)[source]

Function responsible of the transition between the STATE_DECISION and the STATE_RECHARGING or STATE_MOVING. The function will call several functions responsible of the decision state of the robot. It makes a request to the planner server, which is the one responsible of the dummy simulation of the way int which the robot decide the target. The userdata parameter is used to use some variables in the other states.

Parameters

userdata – for output_keys

Returns

transition to the recharging state.

Return type

TRANS_RECHARGING (str)

Returns

transition to the moving state.

Return type

TRANS_DECIDED (str)

class scripts.state_machine.LoadOntology(ontology)[source]

A class to implement the behavior of the decision state of the robot. PICCOLO CHECK

execute(userdata)[source]

Function responsible of the loading of the environment. It calls the LoadMap() function which is the one responsible of the creation of the environment. The input parameter userdata is not used since no data is required from the other states.

Parameters

userdata – not used

Returns

transition to the STATE_DECISION

Return type

TRANS_INITIALIZED(str)

class scripts.state_machine.MoveToTarget(interface_helper, behavior_helper)[source]

A class to implement the behavior of the moving state of the robot.

Class constructor, i.e., class initializer. Input parameters are:

  • interface_helper: the helper class invoked to interface with the server.

  • behavior_hleper: the helper class invoked to interface with the behavior.

execute(userdata)[source]

Function responsible of the transition between the STATE_MOVING and the STATE_RECHARGING or STATE_DECISION. The function will call several functions responsible of the movement of the robot. It makes a request to the controller server which is the one responsible of the dummy simulation of the movement of the robot from a location to the target. The userdata parameter is used to import parameters from the other states.

Parameters

userdata – for input keys

Returns

transition to the recharging state.

Return type

TRANS_RECHARGING(str)

Returns

transition to the moving state.

Return type

TRANS_MOVED(str)

class scripts.state_machine.Recharging(interface_helper, behavior_helper)[source]

A class to implement the behavior of the recharging state of the robot.

Class constructor, i.e., class initializer. Input parameters are:

  • interface_helper: the helper class invoked to interface with the server.

  • behavior_hleper: the helper class invoked to interface with the behavior.

execute(userdata)[source]

Function responsible of the transition between the STATE_RECHARGING to the STATE_DECISION. It waits until the battery is fully charged and then it changes state. The input parameter userdata is not used since no data is required from the other states.

Parameters

userdata – not used

Returns

transition to the recharging state

Return type

TRANS_RECHARGED(str)

class scripts.state_machine.Surveying(interface_helper, behavior_helper)[source]

A class to simulate the location surveying.

Class constructor, i.e., class initializer. Input parameters are:

  • interface_helper: the helper class invoked to interface with the server.

execute(userdata)[source]

Function responsible of the transition between the STATE_SURVEY to the STATE_DECISION. It waits a specified amount of time for the survey of the location and then make tha transition. If the battery is low it suddenly goes to the STATE_RECHARGING

Parameters

userdata – take input from the STATE_MOVING

Returns

transition to the recharging state

Return type

TRANS_RECHARGING(str)

Returns

transition to the decision state

Return type

TRANS_SURVEYED(str)

scripts.state_machine.main()[source]

This function creates the state machine and defines all the transitions. Jere a nested state machine is created

RobotState Module

ROS node for implementing the robot state. It includes the current position and battery level.

Publishes to:

/state/battery_low the boolean stating if the battery is low or not

Service:

/state/get_pose: Get the robot current pose in the simulation

/state/set_pose: Set the robot current pose in the simulation

class scripts.robot_state.RobotState[source]

The node manager class. This class defines two services to get and set the current robot pose, and a publisher to notify that the battery is low.

A_is_battery_low()[source]

Publish changes of battery levels. This method runs on a separate thread.

A_random_battery_notifier(publisher)[source]

Publish when the battery change state (i.e., high/low) based on a random delay within the interval [self._random_battery_time[0], self._random_battery_time[1]). The message is published through the publisher input parameter and is a boolean value, i.e., True: battery low, False: battery high.

Parameters

publisher (bool) – boolean value stating the battery status

get_pose(response)[source]

The robot/get_pose service implementation. The request input parameter is given by the client as empty. Thus, it is not used. The response returned to the client contains the current robot pose.

Parameters

response – the response of the server

Returns

the position of the robot

Return type

response(GetPoseResponse)

set_pose(request)[source]

The robot/set_pose service implementation. The request input parameter is the current robot pose to be set, as given by the client. This server returns an empty response.

Parameters

request –

Returns

an empty response

Return type

empty (SetPoseResponse)

RobotActions Module
